page.title: 09FORD SCHOOL BUILDING
page.content: FORD SCHOOL BUILDING. There was a school in Ford many years before the 1870 Education Act and the first school was on the same site as the present one.The walls of the original building form parts of some of the present walls and in the school corridor there is an alcove in one of walls which was a window in the first building.Later,the school was transferred to another building in the village and the building became an inn.When the inn moved out of the village the building was enlarged and about 1900 it became the Rectory.It was used for this purpose until 1955 when a new rector felt it was too large.The building was then converted into a school and has been used as such since 1957.
